definition: to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to seem/like/as/if
duck

sentences.english: Investors rush to it, then it is those countless resort.
sentences.chinese: 投资者对它趋之若鹜，到后来，却是割肉者无数。

sentences.english: Young Chinese follow Kaifu Lee`s every move.
sentences.chinese: 李开复，中国的年轻人对其一举一动都趋之若鹜。

sentences.english: Roger in his pre-sentence before execution so that people are flocking towards the sea.
sentences.chinese: 罗杰，他在临刑前的一句话让人们趋之若鹜奔向大海。

sentences.english: In neighbouring Bangladesh, eclipse watchers came out in droves.
sentences.chinese: 在邻近的孟加拉国，月食观察家出来趋之若鹜。

definition: to shrink back/to flinch
to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
competitive/eagerly/to vie
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
there are plenty of such people
no wonder (that...)
pet/favorite/darling
to honor sb as a God (idiom); to revere/to worship/to deify/to make a holy cow of sth/to put sb on a pedestal
to water at the mouth/to drool
to treasure/to be very fond of
to drool (over) (idiom)/to yearn for/to covet/to crave
